meanings.definition: In a way that decisively settles an issue or produces a definite result.
meanings.sent1: The DNA test conclusively proved his innocence.
meanings.sent2: The experiment was conducted conclusively to show the effects of gravity.
meanings.sent3: She was so confident in her answer that she conclusively won the debate.
meanings.sent4: The judge's ruling was as clear as day, conclusively ending the trial.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces fit together so perfectly, conclusively solving the mystery.

meanings.definition: In a way that leaves no doubt or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the weapon matched his, conclusively linking him to the crime.
meanings.sent2: The survey results conclusively showed that most people prefer chocolate over vanilla.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so well-executed that it conclusively fooled the entire audience.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature conclusively signaled the start of winter.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunderclap conclusively announced the arrival of the storm.
